newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israeli troops open fire after Arab boy's funeral.
newsitem.headline: Israeli troops open fire after Arab boy's funeral.

text.p: Israeli soldiers opened fire to disperse Palestinian stone-throwers on Tuesday after the funeral of a 10-year-old boy said to have been killed by a Jewish settler in the West Bank.
Witnesses said four Palestinians suffered teargas inhalation. One was hit on the head with a teargas canister.

The clashes began when 50 masked mourners, walking along a hilltop, threw stones at Israeli cars traveling on a road below used by Jewish settlers of the West Bank. Other mourners joined in, and the soldiers responded.
Witnesses said the soldiers fired live ammunition and rubber bullets and teargas.
During the funeral, about 5,000 mourners vowed to avenge the killing of Hilmi Shosha as his body was laid to rest in the cemetery in Husan village.
Mourners carried banners saying: "Get the Nazis out of our land" and "The criminal settler must be hanged." They carried black and Palestinian flags and shouted slogans vowing to avenge the killing.
Witnesses said a settler had beaten the boy unconscious on suspicion of throwing stones on Sunday. He died on Monday.

Israel Radio said an autopsy performed in Tel Aviv showed that the boy died from internal bleeding in the brain caused by a sharp blow to the neck. Police said earlier there was no proof the settler caused the boy's death.
Police told Israel Radio the security chief of the settlement of Efrat was being held for questioning.
